review.title: Excellent staff. Updated rooms. Big and spacious.
review.reviewText: We have been staying at this hotel for the past 10 years and so happy to see that this year our room was updated. Very big and spacious room.

review.title: Quiet and close to everything
review.reviewText: For an old hotel it was as expected    Water slow to heat up, weak air conditioning, but the common area was nice and the staff accommodating

review.title: Nice no-frills hotel close to tourist attractions
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel four times.  It is inexpensive, and close to many tourist attractions.  Rooms are clean and the staff is helpful.  Wi-fi is in the lobby only, but at least the lobby is pleasant and comfortable.  The hotel is not right next to any particular tourist attraction, but is within short walking distance of many.  This is a good hotel for the budget-minded traveller.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is a few blocks from the Cathedral, the main plazas, Hospicio Cabañas, and other attractions.  Parque Agua Azul is about 10 blocks south.

review.title: Good location for historical access
review.reviewText: Friendly helpful staff. Good location to historical center. We've stayed here before and returned because of the above comments.

review.title: Berry berry bad
review.reviewText:
Dirty room bugs,everywhere no t Google

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us, we work hard to make our guests happy. We appreciate your feedback!

review.title: conveniently located
review.reviewText: We stayed ten days at San Francisco Plaza Hotel and we were able to visit many historical places and museums on foot. We walked to different food venues when we wanted to eat out and we enjoy a great Calandria ride around Centro Historico. The staff at the hotel schedule a tour to Tequila and a tour to Tlaquepaque for us and we had a great time, we always felt welcome at the hotel and the room was always clean and confortable.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and quiet, the staff was helpful and friendly and the building is well kept.
review.negativeRemarks: the service in the restaurant and installing mini refrigerators in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: hotel is centrally located and most historical sites, museums and shopping areas are within walking distance. tours to Tonala, Tequila, Chapala.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us, we work hard to make our guests happy. We appreciate your feedback!

review.reviewText: Noisy at night and poor ventilation. So if you open the window to let air in, you can't sleep because of the noise.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for staying with us, we work hard to make our guests happy. We appreciate your feedback!

review.title: Close to everything....it was located in the middl
review.reviewText: It was located in the middle of the Historic district and night life bars and clubs all around.....

review.title: Internet sucks
review.reviewText: They should not advertise wifi because is not such a thing. The signal is very poor If any

review.title: Colonial Hotel close to Main Plaza
review.reviewText:
Staff at this colonial hotel were friendly, and welcoming.  The rooms are basic, but large with older T.V.'s. The water was always hot when showering during my 1 week stay. The hotel is located on a small unattractive plaza with nightclubs and bars in its proximity, however, it is a short walk to the main plaza and Cathedral, the Degollado Theater, and other major attractions.  City buses are easily accessible from this location.  The hotel has a Mexican-style breakfast buffet and a la carte breakfast menu that included cereal, hotcakes, yogurt, etc.  The dining room/kitchen is open all day until 10 PM, and has Mexican items as well as burgers, club sandwiches, salads, etc.  Prices are reasonable and the food is good.  My favourite was the chicken consommé soup.  There is wifi, although slow at times when accessing from room. 
Overall, this hotel is a good value, and would stay here again when visiting Guadalajara.

review.title: Great location - we like the old Mexican style
review.reviewText:
We loved the location of the San Francisco Hotel. Only a few blocks from the market and close to our favorite restaurant La Chata.  The lobby is wonderful - old style Mexican with lots of canaries and parakeets in cages. Lots of plants -it's a nice place to sit after walking the city.

The bed was so good - the perfect firmness.  No bathtub, which is true of most Mexican hotels.  Some of the staff were not the best, but we were able to communicate and receive what we needed.

A very good bargain- i plan to stay there again when we are back in Guadalajara
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the staff were not very friendly
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic.  The market.  Streets with similar types of businesses on the same street - for example wedding and special occasion dresses, electronics.

review.reviewText: The staff is great.  Internet signal is a bit weak.  Hotel is located at walking distance from many attractions and delicious restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds are a bit hard.
review.locationRemarks: Well located to downtown Guadalajara. Many activities at walking distance.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel near central area to all historic sites
review.negativeRemarks: If they could provide free continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is walking distance to churches, shopping stores, museum, and restaurants

review.reviewText: Found Roaches in the room, that was not sanitary, the rooms could be a bit more cleaner and a bit more sanitized. If these changes were made Yes I would recommend my Family and Friends
review.positiveRemarks: Staff and house keepers were very nice and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Is very good, walk to the Parks and Churches

review.title: Nice hotel near Historic Center, very important.
review.reviewText:
Being in the heart of Plaza Tapatia was a BIG PLUS for this hotel. You walk everywhere.

Clean, inexpensive.

review.title: It is bad hotel i couldn't stay more than 2 houres
review.reviewText: It is bad hotel i couldn't stay more than 2 houres

review.title: Historic Hotel near the Zona Historico
review.reviewText: Overall, the hotel was fine, near the central and historical districts of Guadalajara.  Also very near to the gay nightclub scene if that's what you're looking for.  However, the building is drafty and dusty in places.  (The section we stayed in seemed to be used the most, as the dust was not present in our room.)  Too bad more people don't stay there so they can use the other sections of (what turned out to be) an enormous place.  It should be noted that the neighborhood is not the best -- it was very dark at night and I wound up stepping into a 2-foot hole in the pavement just around the corner from the hotel.  Took quite a fall and wound up with some nasty bruises on my knee and leg.  Still can't believe the city would allow something like that to be there on a street with NO lights at night and without any sign or indication that the hole was there.  For these reasons, I can't say that I recommend this hotel.

When arrived our room was not ready,we had to wait for an hour but the bad thing was that the front desk person did not even apologize to us he was very rude.Beds and pillows were not comfortable at all ,to hard  but the worse was the problem with roaches .there was hardly any water to take a shower and most of the time was very dirty.
review.positiveRemarks: We like the colonial style ,the patios were very relaxing .
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk people needs to be retrained,on how  to treat people have better skills ,be more pleasant with customers.
review.locationRemarks: Location is not the best is unsafe for people to walk

review.title: Never going again
review.reviewText: They first tried to cheat me out of a day, and just smiled when I told them I was checking out the next day.  maid did not clean the room the day before I checked out.  Hotel keeps getting more run down ---- I stayed there six years ago.
